file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-20-03-04 - DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM MUFFLERS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM MUFFLERS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the air distribution system mufflers. B. The distribution system mufflers are installed at the inlet of the air distribution ducts on each side of center fuselage II, under the passenger cabin floor. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM MUFFLERS - ALL 21-20-03-000-801-A REMOVAL DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM MUFFLERS - IN- ALL 21-20-03-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 21-20-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-20-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM MUFFLERS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the distribution system mufflers. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 241 241DF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 242 242DF or 242BF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 251 251BF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 252 252AF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the floor access panel (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 and AMM MPP 06-41-02/100), as applicable: – 242DF or 242BF, and 252AF (Muffler of the RH distribution duct). – 251BF or 241DF (Muffler of the LH distribution duct). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 21-20-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal of the Distribution System Mufflers (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the tiedown straps (1). (2) Loosen the clamps (2). (3) Remove the muffler (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 21-20-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Distribution System Mufflers - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 151 152 B B DET. A 1. TIEDOWN STRAP 3. MUFFLER DET. B 2. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-20-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM MUFFLERS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the distribution system mufflers. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 - IPC 21-22-00 PASSENGER CABIN DISTRIBUTION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 241 241DF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 242 242DF or 242BF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 251 251BF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 252 252AF Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tiedown strap IPC 21-22-00 2 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the passenger cabin floor I. Installation of the Distribution System Mufflers (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the muffler (3) in the installation position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 21-20-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install the clamps (2). (3) Install the tiedown straps (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Install the floor access panel (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 and AMM MPP 06-41-02/100), as applicable: – 242DF or 242BF, and 252AF (Muffler of the RH distribution duct). – 251BF or 241DF (Muffler of the LH distribution duct).
